item.title: the great pretender
item.description:
the great pretender

Silly me I thought I had to force my way in. That I had to break the door down, not knowing that its always open, and its not a verb, its a noun. I would see that door, in shadowy contour. Just slightly ajar. And many times before, I'd get close, but no cigar. Unaware, that; waiting in the dream, for the dreamer to accept, is his role in this grand scheme. Waiting so patiently, where certainty is kept. From here to the other side, we can try to hide, but through love you'll surrender and no matter how well alibied, it will unmask the great pretender.

item.title: now I allow
item.description:
now I allow

I was too blind to notice, when or how. I used to judge, everything, but now, I just allow.

item.title: where you are
item.description:
where you are

Let's think the unthinkable, let's do the undoable. Let us prepare to grapple with the ineffable itself, and see if we may not eff it after all. - Douglas Adams

item.title: I imagine a world
item.description:
I imagine a world

I imagine a world, where there’s no black or white, no one is hated, no reason to fight. I imagine a world, where the good is promoted, no evil agendas, balanced truth is devoted. Imagine a world, full of color and light, where a harmony of good, and the black and white, live truth as they should.

item.title: Good news
item.description:
Good news

The bad news is nothing lasts forever, The good news is nothing lasts forever. - J. Cole.
